alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Northern Brevard County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Brevard County through 415 PM EDT... At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Haulover Canal, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oak Hill, Haulover Canal, Mims, Scottsmoor and Klondike Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
